result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel C Mundigler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Pornography image surcharge ($500 per image at 10 images) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Not to use or possess any computer, Ipad, etc. (anything with internet access) unless approved by Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent and to include sex offender treatment.
No unsupervised contact with any minors.
Must register as a lifetime sex offender.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

4/26/16 - per Attorney Kuhary, he does not require copies of the record since he has already has the court record, but only requires the transcripts from the hearings.

The defendant, by retained counsel, moves to extend the time for requesting transcripts and the circuit court case record.  Based on the facts set forth in the motion, the court concludes that good cause exists for the relief requested.  Therefore,
IT IS ORDERED that the time for requesting transcripts and the circuit court case record is extended to April 27, 2016.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel C Mundigler in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kuhary makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  NOTE:  Court orders doctor's reports and Psychological evaluation report sealed.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

10 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT 
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  7 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Not to use or possess any computer, IPAD, etc. (anything with internet access) unless approved by agent 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; to include sex offender treatment 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No unsupervised contact with: any minors
____Must register as lifetime sex offender
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

PORNOGRAPHY IMAGE SURCHARGE:  $500.00 per image  x  10 images = $5,000.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Order Denying - Defense motion to Dismiss the Mandatory Minimum Penalty Enhancer as being Unconstitutional
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr. on 03/31/15.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daniel C Mundigler in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.
Oral Ruling On:  
Motion filed by the Defense - Dismiss the Mandatory Minimum Penalty Enhancer as being Unconstitutional.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the legislature is fully within there rights to set minimum mandatory penalties (Justifiable and Reasonable).
Minimum mandatory requirements still leave the courts with a great deal of discretion.
Court doesn't find the mandatory minimum penalties as being unconstitutional.
Therefore, Court denies - Defense motion to Dismiss the Mandatory Minimum Penalty Enhancer as being Unconstitutional.
Court signed order.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.
  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
